column2: MC56, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had foot surgery (left) to remove a bunion. My podiatrist put me on 500mg Naprelan twice per day. My right foot became swollen as a result of favoring the left foot while in a cast and now a boot, but now the right ankle has pitting edema. I read on WebMD that NSAIDS (naproxen) can result in edema. I didn't experience the edema until after beginning the Naprelan. I wonder if there is a connection.  It is worrisome and I hope it goes away once I'm off the Naprelan. Has anyone else experienced similar reactions?

column9: My name is Sharon Spencer and 53 yrs. old and I was prescribed this Naprelan Tab/500mg for possible Siatic nerve pain? I had a Heart Attack/2 stents-2003, and again 1-6-10 and bllod clot formed and went to bottom chamber. I need to know if this medicine will cause harm due to my recent events. I have been put on Atenolol-25mg., Enalipril-2.5mg., and Plavix-75mg. I forgot to tell my Cardiologist, but after reading the precautions, I'm not sure I should be taking this. I really like the way it works, but if it can cause blood clots, I need to know.

column2: satchmo, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This medication works very well for post-op swelling in my knee.  However, it took so long for the medication to sustain itself in my bloodstream, that by the time it was constantly effective, it was time for a refill.  Also, once I came off of it, the pain was immense, so I had to start all over again.  It does the job, I just wish there was a less expensive means to this solution.
